text: <@U03V8V08M>: I can relate myself by just looking at the photo
Does anyone have any decent links/bookmarks to some solid Ember + D3 articles?

<@U03V2PZUB>: not sure if it's quite what you're looking for but I found this talk and associated addon really interesting
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SOfwqwqWhMU&list=PL4eq2DPpyBblc8aQAd516-jGMdAhEeUiW>
<https://github.com/ivanvanderbyl/maximum-plaid>

attachments.title: EmberConf 2016: Compose Yourself with Ember and D3 by Ivan Vanderbyl
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: EmberConf 2016: Compose Yourself with Ember and D3 by Ivan Vanderbyl

text: <@U0B47NPJ9>: This looks spot on. Just starting to scratch the surface with D3 (especially with the V4 release) and keen to "do it right".
Ivan has a number of addons but I'd just use the primitives one if I were you
v4 is much better suited for ember

attachments.text: Check out Newbie Remote Conf! 02:38 - Yehuda Katz Introduction Twitter GitHub Blog Tilde Peter Solnic: My time with Rails is up Peter Solnic: Abstractions and the role of a framework (Follow-up) Ember.js The Skylight Blog: Inside Skylight 05:37 - Batching Updates 10:04 - Naming Fastboot Services glimmer 14:19 - Communication Skylight 16:21 - Decorators 19:46 - “Junior Developer” and Knowledge Bias CodeNewbie Ep. 90: Creating EmberJS - Part I with Yehuda Katz CodeNewbie Ep. 91: Creating EmberJS - Part II with Yehuda Katz 28:25 - Termanology in Tech 29:23 - Diversity Women Helping Women Picks Event Driven: How to Run Memorable Tech Conferences by Leah Silber (Yehuda) TypeScript (Yehuda) emberjs/rfcs (Yehuda) rust-lang/rfcs (Yehuda) Pretty Pull Requests (Aimee) Full-Stack Redux Tutorial by Tero Parviainen (Aimee) The mountains (AJ) The quadruple click in iTerm2 (Dave) 2016 UtahJS Conference (Dave) Start With Why by Simon Sinek (Chuck)

text:
<@U03V2PZUB>: I'd highly recommend you through this book. It's based on v3 however does a really great job at explaining there concepts and thinking behind D3. Really gave me that "aaahhhhh" moment I needed to grok it 

<http://alignedleft.com/work/d3-book>

attachments.title: Interactive Data Visualization for the Web — Scott Murray — alignedleft
attachments.fallback: Interactive Data Visualization for the Web — Scott Murray — alignedleft

text: <@U043AB2QT>: perfection. I'll give it a bash!
Hint: The seeming "chaining" of functions doesn't work quite as you'd expect it to. Understanding how this works was a big unlock for me.
